data.title: Images by SirSchebling
data.meta_description:
#warthunder #live_wt #workshop

BI-1
Before and during WW2 all major powers made experiments with rocket powered aircraft. Rocket engines offered enormous power but were quite dangerous to handle and burned through their fuel very quickly, resulting in minimal range.
After the first steps in rocket aircraft development had been made, TsAGI (Central Aerohydrodynamic Institute) hosted a conference for aircraft designers on the subject of ramjet and rocket propulsion in spring 1940. A few months later the SNK (Council of People\'s Commissars) called for a high-speed stratospheric aircraft powered by one of these new technologies
